intro: Verbascum karyeteinii, commonly known as the Karatekin mullein, is a species of flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are broad and velvety, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Verbascum karyeteinii is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking floral display.
